exam.title: Departamento de Idiomas. Escuela de Guerra | INGLÉS
exam.intro1: En las sucesivas presentaciones usted encontrará preguntas de tipo test relacionadas con la conversación que debe escuchar previamente en la parte izquierda de la misma.
exam.intro2: Después de escuchar la conversación en inglés deberá responder a una de las preguntas de la parte derecha.
exam.intro3: Gracias por su colaboración. A continuación podrá imprimir las respuestas que han sido seleccionadas, o bien imprimirlas en un archivo pdf para su entrega al profesor correspondiente.
exam.timeOver: Su tiempo ha terminado. Pulse finalizar e imprima sus respuestas

question.Question: 1. Choose the correct statement

answers.answ1: A. It was okay where I left my car
answers.answ2: B. It was not okay where I left my car
answers.answ3: C. I left my car and walked
answers.answ4: D. I always drive on the left

question.Question: 2. Choose the correct statement

answers.answ1: A. We helped the bulldog
answers.answ2: B. The Bulldog was feeble.
answers.answ3: C. The Bulldog was lying in the middle of the road.
answers.answ4: D. The Bulldog was a week old pup.

question.Question: 3. Choose the correct statement

answers.answ1: A. I haven’t drunk too much coffee.
answers.answ2: B. I would feel nervous if I didn’t drink so much coffee.
answers.answ3: C. I wouldn’t be nervous if I drank coffee.
answers.answ4: D. I have drunk a lot of coffee.

question.Question: 4. Choose the correct statement

answers.answ1: A. Motivation and experience determine success.
answers.answ2: B. Motivation doesn’t determine success.
answers.answ3: C. Experience alone often determines success.
answers.answ4: D. Motivation usually determines success.

question.Question: 5. Choose the correct statement

answers.answ1: A. I’m dying to get the new Harry Potter book.
answers.answ2: B. I’ll wait to get the new Harry Potter book.
answers.answ3: C. I couldn’t wait to buy the new Harry Potter book.
answers.answ4: D. I have just bought the new Harry Potter book.

question.Question: 6. Choose the correct statement

answers.answ1: A. Before long it will be summer.
answers.answ2: B. You can tell it will be a long summer.
answers.answ3: C. We will have to wait for the long days of summer.
answers.answ4: D. I long for the days of summer

question.Question: 7. What can be deduced from this conversation?

answers.answ1: A. John has forgotten the man
answers.answ2: B. John will be back for the man
answers.answ3: C. John is waiting for the man.
answers.answ4: D. John is holding the man up.

question.Question: 8. Choose the correct statement

answers.answ1: A. Weather permitting, the barbecue will take place.
answers.answ2: B. The barbecue is taking place because of the weather.
answers.answ3: C. The barbecue was called off.
answers.answ4: D. The barbecue took place despite the weather.

question.Question: 9. What does the man mean?

answers.answ1: A. He is faced with a wide selection of hats.
answers.answ2: B. He can’t decide until he sees more hats.
answers.answ3: C. It’s hard to choose from so few hats.
answers.answ4: D. The hats he has seen are spoiled.

question.Question: 10. What does the man mean?

answers.answ1: A. The woman’s offer fell short.
answers.answ2: B. The woman's offer was over the top.
answers.answ3: C. The man has decided not to sell the house.
answers.answ4: D. The man prefers to wait for a higher offer.

question.Question: 11. What does the man mean?

answers.answ1: A. Mike’s Porsche is red not black
answers.answ2: B. Mike’s car is parked opposite the bookstore.
answers.answ3: C. The red Porsche is unfamiliar.
answers.answ4: D. Mike could be in the book store.

question.Question: 12. What does the woman infer?

answers.answ1: A. This war was shorter than the last.
answers.answ2: B. The woman will be surprised when the war finishes.
answers.answ3: C. The latest war was long-lasting.
answers.answ4: D. The latest war was brief.

question.Question: 13. What does the woman mean?

answers.answ1: A. She has trouble with her eyesight
answers.answ2: B. She doesn’t believe the couple took their flight.
answers.answ3: C. Debbie and Jeff often fight.
answers.answ4: D. She was taken aback by their fight.

question.Question: 14. What does the man mean?

answers.answ1: A. He will fix the problem with the lift himself
answers.answ2: B. He will go to maintenance and report the problem
answers.answ3: C. He’ll arrange for a new elevator to be installed
answers.answ4: D. He’ll phone for someone to fix the electrical problem

question.Question: 15. What is the man waiting for?

answers.answ1: A. A TV programme to begin.
answers.answ2: B. His friends to watch a TV programme with him.
answers.answ3: C. A TV programme to finish.
answers.answ4: D. Some friends to pay a call.

question.Question: 16. What does the man mean?

answers.answ1: A. Wars are being presented as entertainment.
answers.answ2: B. Television confuses people’s perception of things.
answers.answ3: C. Television influences the outcome of most wars
answers.answ4: D. Television is to blame for the outbreak of war.

question.Question: 17. What does the woman say?

answers.answ1: A. Her client is confessing his guilt.
answers.answ2: B. Her client is aiding the investigation.
answers.answ3: C. Her client is hindering the investigation.
answers.answ4: D. Her client is recording the conversation.

question.Question: 18. What does the woman say?

answers.answ1: A. Strides have been made in modern warfare.
answers.answ2: B. The enemy was able to retaliate.
answers.answ3: C. Methods of warfare remain unchanged.
answers.answ4: D. Modern warfare has gone downhill.

question.Question: 19. What does the man mean?

answers.answ1: A. He guesses their friends will be over for an hour.
answers.answ2: B. Their friends will stay for less than an hour.
answers.answ3: C. Their friends will turn up in barely an hour.
answers.answ4: D. Things won’t start for at least an hour.

question.Question: 20. What can be inferred from what the man says?

answers.answ1: A. Journalists cover wars for financial reasons.
answers.answ2: B. The chances of being wounded are not high.
answers.answ3: C. Excitement is not the most important aspect of war journalism.
answers.answ4: D. Prestige is not the most important aspect of war journalism.

question.Question: 21 Which of the following statements is true according to what you have heard?

answers.answ1: A. The Andes mountain range is 7,000 miles long
answers.answ2: B. Michael Jacobs witnessed extreme events
answers.answ3: C. The journey took six months
answers.answ4: D. Humbolt explored only deserts and ice-fields in the Andes

question.Question: 22. Which statement is true according to what you have heard?

answers.answ1: A. Teams of Afghans searched for minerals in dozens of sites
answers.answ2: B. It is unclear how much the mineral resources are worth
answers.answ3: C. Economic viability has always been part of the counterinsurgency effort
answers.answ4: D. The resources are set to become economically viable

question.Question: 23. Which of the statements is true according to what you have heard?

answers.answ1: A. The Obama inauguration took place on a weekend and collapsed the Internet
answers.answ2: B. There Is less Internet traffic at the weekend because people see matches on TV
answers.answ3: C. People have TV sets at work so they can see the matches
answers.answ4: D. Twitter’s recent problems were caused by the spike in traffic due to the World Cup

question.Question: 24. Which of the statements is true according to what you have heard?

answers.answ1: A. Coins or credit cards will not be used in Washington DC as of October
answers.answ2: B. Pay-by-phone parking has been the norm in European cities for a long time
answers.answ3: C. Westminster sold all its old parking metres on eBay
answers.answ4: D. There are no coin-operated parking meters in Westminster anymore

question.Question: 25. Which of the following statements is true according to what you have heard?

answers.answ1: A. The American ambassador in Afghanistan is single
answers.answ2: B. McChrystal was fired for revealing details of war policy
answers.answ3: C. Petreaus has a proven track record in civilian- military relations
answers.answ4: D. Relations between McChrystal and President Karazi were tense

question.Question: 26. Which of the following statements is true according to what you have heard?

answers.answ1: A. Teachers will have to take part in gun fighting if it is near their classrooms
answers.answ2: B. Officially the number of blockades set up by the Zetas was 40
answers.answ3: C. Drivers were dragged out of their cars by gunmen
answers.answ4: D. Trucks buses and cars were set alight after the drivers had been removed

question.Question: 27. Which one of the following statements is true according to what you have heard?

answers.answ1: A. Having a friend perform the ceremony is ideal for couples of different religions
answers.answ2: B. The clergy believe this causes couples to lose their faith
answers.answ3: C. Uncertified people performing wedding ceremonies is not a problem
answers.answ4: D. You can become a clergyman in a matter of seconds over the Internet

question.Question: 28. Which statement is true according to what you have heard?

answers.answ1: A. Gene’s dad was quite talkative and outgoing
answers.answ2: B. Gene’s description of the mine is first hand
answers.answ3: C. The coalmines were subject to frequent explosions
answers.answ4: D. After dinner Gene’s father returned to the mine to work for a few more hours

question.Question: 29. Which statement is true according to what you have heard?

answers.answ1: A. The president of FIFA believes human error makes soccer exciting
answers.answ2: B. A microchip in the ball has changed the nature of the game
answers.answ3: C. English fans reject experiments in football
answers.answ4: D. FIFA is willing to adopt new technologies in football

question.Question: 30. Which statement is correct according to what you have heard?

answers.answ1: A. All of the countries have rising government debt
answers.answ2: B. Maternal and child health is on the agenda for discussion
answers.answ3: C. The Middle East will not be discussed this time round
answers.answ4: D. Protests against the summit have been a headache for security

question.Question: 31. Which statement is true according to what you have heard?

answers.answ1: A. 200 people have been laid off at the Pilkington Tiles factory
answers.answ2: B. Bolton Council will have to cut savings by 40 % in the next five years
answers.answ3: C. There was rioting after England lost to Germany in a World Cup match
answers.answ4: D. Bolton Council has introduced temporary contracts

question.Question: 32. Which of the following statements is true about the student’s plight?

answers.answ1: A. He has lived all his life in the United States
answers.answ2: B. He refuses to use United States identification
answers.answ3: C. He has never had a passport
answers.answ4: D. He will get a Harvard lawyer to plead his case

question.Question: 33. Which statement is true according to what you have heard?

answers.answ1: A. The head discovered is made of bronze
answers.answ2: B. After the discovery of the heads Europeans rewrote art history
answers.answ3: C. The head symbolizes a culture that left us no evidence in writing
answers.answ4: D. Heads were discovered in Ife at the turn of the last century

question.Question: 34. Which statement is true according to what Gettleman says?

answers.answ1: A. Current conflicts show a sense of ideology
answers.answ2: B. Previous liberation movements wanted to change society
answers.answ3: C. In the Congo rebel groups have a lot of popular support
answers.answ4: D. Rebel groups in Somalia have a certain amount of support among the population

question.Question: 35. Why is Randy Borman an important figure for the Cofan Indians?

answers.answ1: A. He likes to wear the traditional dress of the Cofan Indians
answers.answ2: B. He helps them to acquire rainforest territory
answers.answ3: C. He can communicate with them in fluent Cofan
answers.answ4: D. He doesn’t mind living in a forest infested with jaguars and bears

question.Question: 36. What was revealed in the FBI files?

answers.answ1: A. Several assassination attempts on Ted Kennedy’s life
answers.answ2: B. That Ted Kennedy was a security threat
answers.answ3: C. The Kennedys were partial to being monitored
answers.answ4: D. How the FBI actually operated

question.Question: 37. Which statement is true according to what you have heard?

answers.answ1: A. Marcel was employed by BP for a long time
answers.answ2: B. His preferred wedding spot is full of tar balls and oil mousse
answers.answ3: C. He has filed a claim for business interruption
answers.answ4: D. Crashing waves, ideal for weddings, are fewer

question.Question: 38. Which statement is true according to what you have heard?

answers.answ1: A. The last amnesty was in 1959 after Fidel Castro came to power
answers.answ2: B. The EU wants to normalize relations so US citizens can travel to Cuba
answers.answ3: C. Cuba has received international condemnation for its treatment of the prisoners
answers.answ4: D. The US Congress has passed a law which annuls the travel ban

question.Question: 39. Choose the correct statement

answers.answ1: A. Shiite Muslims make frequent pilgrimages to Bagdhad
answers.answ2: B. The shrine is in a neighbourhood previously controlled by Shiites
answers.answ3: C. The most direct route to the Shiite shrine is through a Sunni area
answers.answ4: D. Sunni insurgents joined forces with the Americans

question.Question: 40. Choose the correct statement

answers.answ1: A. The pilot glided for 26 hours over the Swiss Alps
answers.answ2: B. The plane is the size of an Airbus and travelled at 78 miles an hour
answers.answ3: C. The plane is part of a long-term energy-saving project
answers.answ4: D. It was unpleasant for the pilot to hear no noise
